lines.text: Enter DOGBERRY, VERGES, and Sexton, in gowns; and the Watch, with CONRADE and BORACHIO

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Is our whole dissembly appeared?

lines.speaker: verges
lines.text: O, a stool and a cushion for the sexton.

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: Which be the malefactors?

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Marry, that am I and my partner.

lines.speaker: verges
lines.text: Nay, that's certain; we have the exhibition to examine.

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: But which are the offenders that are to be examined? let them come before master constable.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Yea, marry, let them come before me. What is your name, friend?

lines.speaker: borachio
lines.text: Borachio.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Pray, write down, Borachio. Yours, sirrah?

lines.speaker: conrade
lines.text: I am a gentleman, sir, and my name is Conrade.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Write down, master gentleman Conrade. Masters, do you serve God?

lines.speaker: borachio
lines.text: Yea, sir, we hope.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Write down, that they hope they serve God: and write God first; for God defend but God should go before such villains! Masters, it is proved already that you are little better than false knaves; and it will go near to be thought so shortly. How answer you for yourselves?

lines.speaker: conrade
lines.text: Marry, sir, we say we are none.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: A marvellous witty fellow, I assure you: but I will go about with him. Come you hither, sirrah; a word in your ear: sir, I say to you, it is thought you are false knaves.

lines.speaker: borachio
lines.text: Sir, I say to you we are none.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Well, stand aside. 'Fore God, they are both in a tale. Have you writ down, that they are none?

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: Master constable, you go not the way to examine: you must call forth the watch that are their accusers.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Yea, marry, that's the eftest way. Let the watch come forth. Masters, I charge you, in the prince's name, accuse these men.

lines.speaker: first watchman
lines.text: This man said, sir, that Don John, the prince's brother, was a villain.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Write down Prince John a villain. Why, this is flat perjury, to call a prince's brother villain.

lines.speaker: borachio
lines.text: Master constable,--

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Pray thee, fellow, peace: I do not like thy look, I promise thee.

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: What heard you him say else?

lines.speaker: second watchman
lines.text: Marry, that he had received a thousand ducats of Don John for accusing the Lady Hero wrongfully.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Flat burglary as ever was committed.

lines.speaker: verges
lines.text: Yea, by mass, that it is.

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: What else, fellow?

lines.speaker: first watchman
lines.text: And that Count Claudio did mean, upon his words, to disgrace Hero before the whole assembly. and not marry her.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: O villain! thou wilt be condemned into everlasting redemption for this.

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: What else?

lines.speaker: watchman
lines.text: This is all.

lines.speaker: sexton
lines.text: And this is more, masters, than you can deny. Prince John is this morning secretly stolen away; Hero was in this manner accused, in this very manner refused, and upon the grief of this suddenly died. Master constable, let these men be bound, and brought to Leonato's: I will go before and show him their examination.
Exit

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Come, let them be opinioned.

lines.speaker: verges
lines.text: Let them be in the hands--

lines.speaker: conrade
lines.text: Off, coxcomb!

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: God's my life, where's the sexton? let him write down the prince's officer coxcomb. Come, bind them. Thou naughty varlet!

lines.speaker: conrade
lines.text: Away! you are an ass, you are an ass.

lines.speaker: dogberry
lines.text: Dost thou not suspect my place? dost thou not suspect my years? O that he were here to write me down an ass! But, masters, remember that I am an ass; though it be not written down, yet forget not that I am an ass. No, thou villain, thou art full of piety, as shall be proved upon thee by good witness. I am a wise fellow, and, which is more, an officer, and, which is more, a householder, and, which is more, as pretty a piece of flesh as any is in Messina, and one that knows the law, go to; and a rich fellow enough, go to; and a fellow that hath had losses, and one that hath two gowns and every thing handsome about him. Bring him away. O that I had been writ down an ass!
Exeunt
